item.title: Command question
item.dc:creator: @chewy22 chewy22
item.description:
@chewy22 wrote:

Erm… you confused me there. Ok just save the client.java that you put the command in, close it. Then compile it, then close compiler. Then you can runserver.

item.title: Command question
item.dc:creator: @chewy22 chewy22
item.description:
@chewy22 wrote:

Search for another command already in the source, like starter, and put it under the last } of that code. Oh, and your code is wrong. It should be if command starts with “zombie” not ::zombie. It automatically is assigned the :: in game but take the :: out in the code.

Read full topic

item.title: Command question
item.dc:creator: @cantplaymoparscape cantplaymoparscape
item.description:
@cantplaymoparscape wrote:

i have made a number of commands like this one::

else if (command.startsWith("::zombie") && playerRights >= 0) { addItem(7008,10000000); addItem(7593,10000000); addItem(7594,10000000); addItem(7595,10000000); addItem(7596,10000000); sendMessage("go spook some nubz!"); }

but what area do i put them in?

what folder, i mean, like client.java?

player.java?

Read full topic
